newsitem.title: USA: U.S. West Coast lt. crudes fall further under WTI.
newsitem.headline: U.S. West Coast lt. crudes fall further under WTI.

text.p: U.S. West Coast light crude prices came under further pressure from West Texas Intermediate (WTI) late, while a full cargo of Alaskan crude sold Thursday at a $2.20 discount.
Traders said Exxon sold a cargo of Alaska North Slope (ANS) crude on Thursday to a West Coast refiner at the discount.
It was the second cargo the refinery bought this week, traders said. The earlier shipment was also priced a $2.20 under.
Meanwhile, December WTI fell 20 cents from late Thursday levels, to finish $24.10/24.20 a barrel, amid thin activity.
Outright prices for ANS fell with WTI to $21.80/22.10 a barrel.
Line 63 crude remained thinly traded in typical early month discussion.
A 75-cent rise in California posted prices on Thursday, helped lift Kern River and Wilmington grades.
Wilmington crude rose to $18.10/$18.20 a barrel, while bids for Kern River crude firmed $16.70/$16.90 a barrel.
